name: Purgatory Gatekeeper
description:
***** MAC USERS - See instructions below *****

"Do unto others as you would have them do unto you."

How did you live your life? Did you spend your days committing violent crimes? Feeding the hungry? Stepping on your sister's toes? Once death comes, there's no hiding anymore.  And your fate is left in the hands one being... The Purgatory Gatekeeper!

Inspired by Papers Please, you become the judge! Examine the lives of all who enter death's door. Decide who is good enough to enter The Good Place, and who deserves to be punished for the rest of time! Weigh up their good deeds against their bad, and choose what exactly they'll be doing and how long they must be subjected to it for...

Step into the role of the Purgatory Gatekeeper and serve, justice one soul at a time!

This game was developed in 48 hours as an entry for the first-ever FullTimeGameDev Jam! Theme? "The Golden Rule"...

Art by Hannah Mullinex.

Code and Premise by Cuba "Shiba Dog" Stanley and Jadon Mullinex.

Instructions for Mac OS X:

OS X, being a unix based operating system, requires executable flags on apps to be able to run them. When building a Unity project on Windows, these flags aren't added as it isn't possible by default on the Windows operating system. This results in a message "The app 'Mac' could not be opened" when trying to open on OS X. This issue can be resolved as follows:

1. Go into System Settings > Security and Privacy to enable non-Apple Store apps to run.

2. In the Terminal, navigate to the download folder (wherever you put the downloaded app) using the following command:
cd [PATH_TO_APP_FOLDER]

3. Grant executable permissions using the following command:
chmod -R 777 ./Mac.app

This will unlock permissions for the app to run. You'll then need to allow permission through Mac Firewall to let it run on the computer.

Right click on the app and a dropdown window will pop up. Click "Open" in this list and in the subsequent popup click "Open" again.
